Description: Lower body sherd (mended from seven joining and one non-joining (732a) fragment) of Chian Mature Animal Style or Grand Style pottery heavy chalice with part of handle root; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (partly worn) with two pairs of added white bands; exterior reserved with four glaze bands; black on handle; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The full inscription on the sherd is published in C.A. Hutton, 'Inscriptions on pottery from Naukratis' Classical Review 7 (1893) 82, 1. Gardner 1888 only has part. Chalice kraters are found in the Mature Animal and Grand Styles.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1607) (phase 2)
